channel.title: Compiler Question
channel.description:
I tried everything! I download jdk6, but when i run my compiler i get "javac is not a command" thing. Is there a way to compile without java?
Thanks

item.title: Compiler Question
item.dc:creator: @Gamerstips Gamerstips
item.description:
@Gamerstips wrote:

Gamma, I LOVE YOU!!! I had that error for 5 months, THANKS!!!1

item.title: Compiler Question
item.dc:creator: @gamma gamma
item.description:
@gamma wrote:

right click your compiler and go to edit

replace what yours says with this:(yes its taharok’s compiler not mine)

@echo off
title ‘Perfect Compiler’ 2.0
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
echo If the site does not show up, please go to: http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
“%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe” http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
:end
echo Used %p% to compile your files!
pause
exit

Read full topic
